newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS MONDAY SOFTER ON MAJOR UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS MONDAY SOFTER ON MAJOR UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed Monday slightly softer against most major currencies in quiet trade, and foreign exchange dealers said they expected it to stay stable ahead of the Christmas holidays.
"There was very little business...and we are likely to close for the holidays tomorrow (Tuesday) at around these same levels," one dealer said.
The Zimbabwe dollar -- which started Monday at 10.8000/8200 to the U.S. dollar -- ended the day at 10.8050/8250 against its Friday close of 10.7950/8150.
It closed Monday's session weaker at 18.1000/1500 against pound sterling from 17.9550/18.0000 last Friday.

Against the German mark, the local currency was quoted at 6.9500/9700 compared to 6.9400/9600, and at 2.3000/3200 against the rand of South Africa -- Zimbabwe's main trading partner in Africa -- from Friday's closing rate of 2.3065/3155.
